messages: 94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (05:46): surkov: hi
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (05:52): hi, tbsaunde
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:07): surkov: do you have any plans or hope to clean up the textattr stuff?
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:08): tbsaunde: what do you mean?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:08): its pretty confusing, I'm not really sure I'm smart enough to review your patches
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:08): especially the bit where you inherit from the template instatiation
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:13): I didn't wanted to rewrite testattr stuff, I have a feeling I like impl :)
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:15): I see
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:15): want to explain how it works then? I don't really get it
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:16): I think even if we don't totally rewrite things nsITextAttr can almost certainly go away

f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:29): tbsaunde: nsITextAttr is just an interface implemented for each text attribute, it allows to compare two values of text attribute and get string representation of it
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:30): nsTextAttrsMgr runs through accessible tree and for each node, ask each text attr instance to compare with the value of traversed element
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:30): if value is the same then it continues to run, if not then it found a range
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:32): tbsaunde: you should give a chance to nsITextAttr maybe it conquers your heart :)
47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (06:33): <email/> requested approval-mozilla-beta from the wind for attachment 600415 on bug 718235.
47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (06:33): <email/> requested approval-mozilla-aurora from the wind for attachment 600415 on bug 718235.
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:33): surkov: yeah, I might be fine with the general design not sure yet

47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (06:33): Bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=718235 maj, --, ---, nobody, NEW, [SeaMonkey] "a11y/accessible/events/test_focus_general.html | Doubled event { event type: focus, tar
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:33): but the interface class seems sort of silly
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:33): it allows you to add/change text attribute quite easy, all you need is override three methods, name, comparison and value
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:34): yeah, but understanding the controll flow is ... hard
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:36): yeah, I don't see a reason why we need to keep nsITextAttr and nsTextAttr both
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:43): maybe the point was we need not templated version of nsTextAttr
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:45): surkov: yeah, or maybe there was a time there was other things that implemented nsITextAttr but not nsTextAttr?
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:46): I have doubts
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:46): surkov: about what?
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (06:46): about we had something different thant nsTextAttr
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:49): oh, ok

94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:56): surkov: btw I think I know what my problem with orca was, I think basically I had enough stuff in awsume bar autocomplete that we fired so many events that orca thought it was being flooded
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:57): I believe the problem is that we fire a lot more accessible-parent events than we should
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (06:57): I think its a trivial ptch
47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (07:00): Bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=414491 maj, P1, mozilla1.9, nobody, NEW, Too many accessible events when typing in Firefox3 location bar
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (07:09): that might be related
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (07:09): forgot about it
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (07:11): surkov: looks like no, the bug I'm seeing is linux specific dumbness
